sen.j: 良円（りょうえん、治承3年7月13日 (旧暦)（1179年8月17日） - 承久2年1月14日 (旧暦)（1220年2月19日）は、平安時代末期から鎌倉時代前期にかけての興福寺の僧。
sen.e: Ryoen (August 17, 1179 - February 19, 1220) was a monk of the Kofuku-ji Temple during the late Heian era through the early Kamakura era.
Ryoen (August 17, 1179 - February 19, 1220) was a monk of Kofuku-ji Temple during the late Heian era through the early Kamakura era.
Ryoen (August 24, 1179 - February 26, 1220) was a priest of Kofuku-ji Temple during the late Heian period through the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にし、用語を指示書に合わせました。monk→priestに変更

sen.j: 父は太政大臣九条兼実。
sen.e: Ryoen's father was Kanezane KUJO, who was the Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 兼実の同母弟である慈円の弟子であった。
sen.e: He was a disciple of Jien, who had the same mother as and the younger brother of Kanezane.

sen.e: He was a disciple of Jien, who had the same mother as and was the younger brother of Kanezane.
He was a disciple of Jien, who was the younger brother of Kanezane.
sen.cmt: 表現を統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 後に天台座主となった良快とは同母兄弟である。
sen.e: Ryoen had the same mother as Ryokai, who later became Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect).

sen.e: Ryoen had the same mother as Ryokai, who later became Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect).
Ryokai, who later became Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect), was his brother.
sen.cmt: 表現を統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 1189年（文治5年）に父の意向で出家し興福寺に入り、別当職を辞したばかりの信円に師事して法相教学を受けた。
sen.e: Ryoen entered into priesthood at Kofuku-ji Temple in 1189 following his father's will, and learned Dharmalogy of the Hosso Study from his master Shinen, who had just resigned from the position of betto (chief officer).

Ryoen entered into priesthood at Kofuku-ji Temple in 1189 following his father's will, and learned Dharmalogy of the Hosso Study from his master Shinen, who had just resigned from the position of betto (chief officer).

sen.j: 1196年（建久7年）には18歳にして維摩会の講師となった。
sen.e: Ryoen became the koshi (monk lecturer) of Yuimae (a Buddhist service for the Yuima Sutra held at Kofuku-ji Temple) in 1196 at the age of 18.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

Ryoen became the koshi (priest lecturer) of Yuimae (a Buddhist service for the Yuima Sutra held at Kofuku-ji Temple) in 1196 at the age of 18.

sen.j: その優れた才能故に師である信円や父である兼実のみならず、父の政敵であった源通親の弟である雅縁などからも将来を嘱望され、1207年（承元元年）に雅縁の跡を襲う形で興福寺別当職に就いた。
sen.e: Because of his excellent talent, his master Shinen, his father Kanezane, and even Gaen who was the brother of MINAMOTO no Michichika (he was Kanezane's political enemy) had high expectations from Ryoen, and assumed the position of betto from Gaen at Kofuku-ji Temple in 1207.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because of his excellent talent, his master Shinen, his father Kanezane, and even Gaen who was the brother of MINAMOTO no Michichika (he was Kanezane's political enemy) had high expectations from Ryoen, and assumed the position of betto from Gaen at Kofuku-ji Temple in 1207.

Because of his excellent talent, not only his master Shinen and his father Kanezane, but also Gaen who was the younger brother of MINAMOTO no Michichika (he was Kanezane's political enemy) had high expectations to Ryoen, and assumed the position of betto from Gaen at Kofuku-ji Temple in 1207.
sen.cmt: 表現を原文に合わせました。

sen.j: しかしながら生来病弱であったらしく別当職の激務に耐えられず、翌1208年（承元2年）にわずか1年あまりでその職を辞した。
sen.e: However, since he was born weak and could not handle the hard work of betto, Ryoen resigned from the position only in a year in 1208.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

However, since he was born weak and could not handle the hard work of betto, in the following year 1208, Ryoen resigned from the position in just over a year.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて補足しました。

sen.j: 1218年（建保6年）に再度別当職に就いていた雅縁の後継として別当職に補され僧正となったものの、在任中の1220年（承久2年）に一条院で没している。
sen.e: In 1218, he became Sojo (high-ranking Buddhist priest) and assumed the position of betto from Gaen, who had taken the position again, but died in 1220 at the Ichijo-in Temple while he was still in the position.
